hssEngine Class Reference

#include <hssEngine.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Basic sound class.

Use this class to open/close/supend/resume sound output and to play sounds.


Public Member Functions

Member Function Documentation

s32 hssEngine::open (  u32  freqmix,
u32  bps,
bool  stereo,
u32  maxmodchannels = MOD_MIN,
u32  maxsfxchannels = SFX_MIN
) 
 

Initialize the Hekkus Sound System.

Open sound output at freqmix, setup a thread for sound update and alloc specified channels.

Parameters:
freqmix output rate in hz, only 11025, 22050 and 44100 are supported.
bps select 16 or 8 bit output.
stereo enable stereo output (true == stereo, false == mono).
maxmodchannels maximum number of ProTracker channels available.
maxsfxchannels maximum number of Wave channels available.
Returns:
true on success, false on failure.

HSS_API s32 hssEngine::close (   ) 
 

Shut down the Hekkus Sound System.

All sounds are stopped, thread are deallocated.
You have however manually deallocated all Sounds and Musics previous allocated.

Returns:
true on success, false on failure.

HSS_API void hssEngine::suspend (   ) 
 

Suspend sound output.

Suspend all sounds, thread and sound output. Call it when your app are minimized or lose focus.

HSS_API void hssEngine::resume (   ) 
 

Resume sound output.

Resume all sounds, thread and sound output. Call it when your app regain focus after a suspend call.

HSS_API hssChannel * hssEngine::channel (  s32  chl  ) 
 

Get a playing or paused hssChannel.

Parameters:
chl hssChannel number to get. Should be a vaule returned from playSound() or playMusic() function.
Returns:
hssChannel pointer on success, 0 on failure.

HSS_API u32 hssEngine::maxChannelMusic (   ) 
 

Get the total number of Music channels allocated.

Returns:
Number of Music channels allocated.

Get the total number of Sound channels allocated.

Returns:
Number of Sound channels allocated.

Get the number of Music channels that are playing.

Returns:

HSS_API u32 hssEngine::playingChannelSound (   ) 
 

Get the number of Sound channels that are playing.

Returns:
Number of Sound channels that are playing.

HSS_API s32 hssEngine::playSound (  hssSound *  sndfx,
bool  paused = false
) 
 

Play a Sound on the first Sound hssChannel available.

Play a Sound using the sample's default volume and loop settings. If all the Sound hssChannel are playing this sound will discarded and not played.

Parameters:
sndfx pointer to the Sound to be played.
paused Start the sound paused or not.
Returns:
the channel assigned to this Sound on success, -1 on failure.

HSS_API void hssEngine::stopSound (   ) 
 

Stop all playing and paused Sound hssChannel.

All stopped hssChannel will be available for other play.

HSS_API void hssEngine::pauseSound (   ) 
 

Pause all playing Sound hssChannel.

HSS_API void hssEngine::resumeSound (   ) 
 

Resume all paused Sound hssChannel.

HSS_API s32 hssEngine::playMusic (  hssMusic *  mod,
bool  paused = false
) 
 

Play a Music on the first Music hssChannel available.

Play a Music using the music's default volume and loop settings. If all the Music hssChannel are playing this sound will be discarded and not played.

Parameters:
mod Pointer to the Music to be played.
paused Start the sound paused or not.
Returns:
the channel assigned to this Music on success, -1 on failure.

HSS_API void hssEngine::stopMusic (   ) 
 

Stop all playing and paused Music hssChannel.

All stopped hssChannel will be available for other play.

HSS_API void hssEngine::pauseMusic (   ) 
 

Pause all playing Music hssChannel.

HSS_API void hssEngine::resumeMusic (   ) 
 

Resume all paused Music hssChannel.

HSS_API void hssEngine::volumeSound (  u32  v  ) 
 

Set master Souns volume.

This value affect ALL Sound hssChannels.

Parameters:
v new master Sound volume. Can vary from 0 to 64. 0 = silence, 64 = full volume.

HSS_API u32 hssEngine::volumeSound (   ) 
 

Get master Sound volume.

HSS_API void hssEngine::volumeMusic (  u32  v  ) 
 

Set master Music volume.

This value affect ALL Music hssChannels.

Parameters:
v new master Music volume. Can vary from 0 to 64. 0 = silence, 64 = full volume.
